summary: The Tribal Forest Protection Act Amendments Act of 2025 amends the original act to improve the protection and restoration of Indian forest land and rangeland. Key changes include expanding the definition of Indian forest land/rangeland, allowing for projects on Federal land, modifying criteria for projects, and authorizing $15 million in appropriations annually from 2026-2031. The bill aims to update and strengthen existing provisions to better manage and conserve forest resources.
